words.hint: A golden trio melts into perfection, but never mix them first.
A national builder, yet never lays a single brick.
This one flies over lakes but never leaves your pocket.
Cold at heart, but worth double the trouble.
A bite of something whole, yet never complete.
A game of warriors, played with webbed spears.
Battles fought on frozen ground, where blades cut but leave no scars.
Red as a maple, steady as a horse, sworn to keep the peace.
It bleeds gold but stands tall.
Heard but not seen, a verbal signature.
Cold walls, warm hearts, home without wood.
Where the trees fear to grow and the ground never wakes.
A hill of voices, speaking for millions.
A forest of steel and glass, where the sky is within reach.
Between sea and sky, where the rain is always welcome.
The silent giant of the northern roads.
A name both worn with pride and tossed in jest.
An ocean without water, where the wind never rests.
A dairy enigma in Eastern Canada, sealed in plastic but never in cartons.
A place to rest that’s neither a field nor a person.
Where the faithful line up before dawn, their devotion paid in change.
Wings are optional, but the flight is inevitable.
The ghost of the ice, feared by all but the cold.
Four walls, a lake, and no cell signal.
It carries whispers over still waters.
A sound that betrays your roots.
The crown of the cold, a pom-pom in its throne.
A hero’s journey, one step at a time, across a nation.
A frozen guide that never moves.
Their peaks touch the sky, but they never fall.
